metadata.title: Week 1 Day 3: Introduction to Latin Nouns

prior_knowledge_digest: Students should have a basic understanding of the Latin alphabet and pronunciation rules. They should be familiar with the concept of nouns in English, including singular and plural forms. Additionally, students should have been introduced to the idea of grammatical gender and number, which are essential for understanding Latin nouns.
yesterday_recap: Yesterday, we explored the Latin alphabet and practiced pronunciation. We also discussed the importance of understanding grammatical gender in Latin.
misconception_watchlist: Confusing Latin noun endings with English

lesson_flow.description: Review the Latin alphabet and pronunciation rules.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students recite the alphabet and practice pronunciation.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Ensure correct pronunciation and address any difficulties.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the concept of Latin nouns, focusing on gender and number.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and take notes on noun gender and number.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use examples to illustrate gender and number.

lesson_flow.description: Practice identifying noun gender and number using flashcards.
lesson_flow.student_action: Work in pairs to sort flashcards by gender and number.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Circulate to provide support and correct misconceptions.

lesson_flow.description: Complete a worksheet on identifying and using Latin noun endings.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Provide hints if necessary, focusing on common errors.

lesson_flow.description: Summarize the key points of the lesson and preview the next lesson.
lesson_flow.student_action: Participate in a brief discussion and ask questions.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Highlight the importance of understanding noun endings.
